name: Dr. Alan Turing
description: Known as the father of modern computer science, Turing made foundational contributions to algorithms and computing.

name: Dr. Marie Curie
description: Pioneered research on radioactivity, becoming the first woman to win a Nobel Prize and the only person to win in two sciences.

name: Dr. Richard Feynman
description: Celebrated for his work in quantum mechanics and particle physics, as well as his engaging teaching style.

name: Dr. Katherine Johnson
description: Her calculations were critical to NASA's space missions, breaking both racial and gender barriers in STEM.

name: Dr. Stephen Hawking
description: Renowned for his work on black holes and relativity, and his bestselling book 'A Brief History of Time'.
